arts.ttl: Ake, Rodri, Bobb - Man City injury latest amid return dates as blow confirmed and hint dropped
arts.sum: Manchester City injury latest as Pep Guardiola's side prepare to face Nottingham Forest in the Premier League

arts.ttl: Sunday’s briefing: Mateta suffers ear injury and Man City survive FA Cup scare
arts.sum: The Eagles striker was caught on the side of the head by the studs of Millwall goalkeeper Liam Roberts as he came out to clear the ball.

arts.ttl: 'Of course not' - Pep Guardiola will not be swayed even if Man City win the FA Cup
arts.sum: Manchester City's hopes of silverware remain alive this season after they progressed to the FA Cup quarter-finals with victory over Plymouth.

arts.ttl: Manchester City transfer latest: Why Kevin De Bruyne could sign contract extension despite Saudi Pro League, MLS interest
arts.sum: Manchester City midfielder Kevin De Bruyne could reject moves to the Saudi Pro League and to MLS clubs and accept a short-term deal to stay with the Citizens.

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola gives exciting Rodri update as Man City star returns to training
arts.sum: Manchester City Rodri has been sidelined with a serious knee injury since September but the Spaniard could be in line for a return to the side sooner rather than later

arts.ttl: Plymouth's Ukrainian goalscorer reveals he hasn't seen his father for three and a half years in emotional interview after FA Cup loss to Man City
arts.sum: Plymouth Argyle defender Maksym Talovierov revealed after Saturday's FA Cup defeat by Man City that he has not seen his Ukrainian father for three and a half years.

arts.ttl: Jack Grealish needs to show far more than during the FA Cup win over Plymouth if he is to force himself into Thomas Tuchel's England squad as season begins to escape him, writes NATHAN SALT
arts.sum: NATHAN SALT AT THE ETIHAD: Manchester City 's £100million man has had to brace himself for disappointment for a while now.

arts.ttl: Jack Grealish should be more than an FA Cup player - he needs to make Man City exit
arts.sum: Manchester City star Jack Grealish may yet add another winners' medal to his Etihad career with the FA Cup - but it shouldn't be enough to keep him with the Blues

arts.ttl: Miron Muslic radiates optimism with Plymouth rising to the occasion | Simon Burnton
arts.athr: Simon Burnton at the Etihad Stadium
arts.sum: Championship strugglers refused to submit to the obvious and unavoidable with performance against Manchester City offering hope Throughout this game, Pep Guardiola patrolled his technical area in a thick, padded, hooded winter coat, hunched against a moderate March chill. A few yards to his right Plymouth’s Miron Muslic seemed to be radiating his own warmth, wearing a flimsy gilet over a thin, cream sweater. The point being, even Muslic’s clothing was optimistic, a refusal to submit to the obvious and unavoidable. And so too his team, for all that in the end they could not quite outrun it. For a while it felt as if Plymouth were controlling the game, inasmuch as it is possible to do so while enjoying 25% of possession, being 39 league places below your opponents and demonstrably worse than them in almost every metric. They rarely looked stretched or panicked, always seemed to know what they should be doing and where they should be doing it. Inferior teams can often hold opponents at bay for a while, throwing themselves into sprints or towards the ball, tiring visibly with every desperate, wild effort. This was not that. This was a team in balance, clearly beautifully prepared and motivated, rising to an occasion that might have humbled them as it has ruined many others. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Teenage talent Nico O’Reilly saves Man City from FA Cup humbling by Plymouth
arts.sum: Manchester City 3-1 Plymouth Argyle: Maksym Talovierov’s first-half goal gave Pep Guardiola’s side a shock
